intro: Gerrardanthus aethiopicus, commonly known as the African daisy, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its showy, daisy-like flowers that bloom in shades of yellow and orange. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas. It has linear, grass-like leaves and produces small, tubular flowers arranged in a composite head. Gerrardanthus aethiopicus is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is adapted to well-drained soils.
